subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-14 06:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie05dd95eaef3d0030d9b3a46602751ddb191d957
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie05dd95eaef3d0030d9b3a46602751ddb191d957

commit_message:
Add Leap 15 jobs

We have leap 15 support in roles, yet, we don't add it to the
template. This should be adding 15.0 as non voting job everywhere.

Change-Id: Ia59e4007e1e39bfbb74fbee6432315afd9be495d

subject: Use pkill for lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-12 17:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7-host.yml', 'templates/lxc-dnsmasq-systemd-init.j2', 'vars/ubuntu-18.04-host.yml', 'vars/gentoo-host.yml', 'vars/suse-host.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04-host.yml'], 'message': "Use pkill for lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file

Previously psmisc was not installed by default, causing
the killall in the lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file to
silently fail if killall wasn't found.  This prevented
running instances of dnsmasq to be torn down when
restarting the service.

This would exhibit as a problem during upgrades as
the older dnsmasq service would be running and the
new service would be unable to take over the port.
This would cause lxc containers to lose connectivity.

This commit switches to using pkill and ensures procps
is always installed by default.

Change-Id: I4fa838706f1163fd68ff68258bfc66cbf13bad94
"}]
commit_message:
Use pkill for lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file

Previously psmisc was not installed by default, causing
the killall in the lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file to
silently fail if killall wasn't found.  This prevented
running instances of dnsmasq to be torn down when
restarting the service.

This would exhibit as a problem during upgrades as
the older dnsmasq service would be running and the
new service would be unable to take over the port.
This would cause lxc containers to lose connectivity.

This commit switches to using pkill and ensures procps
is always installed by default.

Change-Id: I4fa838706f1163fd68ff68258bfc66cbf13bad94

commit_message:
Use XStatic-D3 instead of vendorized d3.js

According to [1] d3.js will be loaded by horizon on the each page
so we don't need to include it manually.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/4e0ee573db4561dc7e0c10835d31d73eddb12aca/openstack_dashboard/utils/settings.py#L196

Story: 2004051
Task: 30403

Change-Id: Icb56905a802f9efba7f9c6558372b62ab5eb9bd4

commit_message:
Fix the verification method before creating and updating the firewall rule

1.Verify the validity of the icmp port when the protocol is configured.
2.When updating the rule, the modified data should be verified.

Change-Id: I4c4b1cc5ff25b67e77669b721df4fdbb7d47515f
Closes-Bug: #1803499

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-24 21:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['sync-test-repos.sh'], 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I687dd60f235fac20af3874f38ad7ab27c2a6f087
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I687dd60f235fac20af3874f38ad7ab27c2a6f087

subject: Ensure the build host is the first repo server
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-12 18:28:51.000000000', 'files': ['vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure the build host is the first repo server

The first repo server is the only one configured to synchronise
packages to the other repo servers. To ensure that the build
happens on the first server, we reverse the order in which they
are processed in the loop.

This does not solve the multi-architecture use-case. A solution
for that will have to follow.

Change-Id: Ie6bd16ac08164f7dba71339858b98137f61ad716
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the build host is the first repo server

The first repo server is the only one configured to synchronise
packages to the other repo servers. To ensure that the build
happens on the first server, we reverse the order in which they
are processed in the loop.

This does not solve the multi-architecture use-case. A solution
for that will have to follow.

Change-Id: Ie6bd16ac08164f7dba71339858b98137f61ad716

subject: Collect all of systemd configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-13 04:27:20.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/log-collect.sh'], 'message': 'Collect all of systemd configuration

Collect /etc/systemd instead of /etc/systemd/network. OSA drops a
considerable amount of other configuration in /etc/systemd, such
as custom units, resolved configuration, etc. When debugging gate
failures, the unit files will be very helpful to see logged.

Change-Id: I9371e3d98f7581c2210a0e18ac3e2970847ce411
'}]
commit_message:
Collect all of systemd configuration

Collect /etc/systemd instead of /etc/systemd/network. OSA drops a
considerable amount of other configuration in /etc/systemd, such
as custom units, resolved configuration, etc. When debugging gate
failures, the unit files will be very helpful to see logged.

Change-Id: I9371e3d98f7581c2210a0e18ac3e2970847ce411

subject: docs: drop sphinxmark
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-04 05:14:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt'], 'message': 'docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I7eeca9d7f5a519bdcd4ceedd1b2bb64540b163c0
'}]
commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I7eeca9d7f5a519bdcd4ceedd1b2bb64540b163c0

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Sem-Ver: feature

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-01-12 03:19:29.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idf52b7aeecc46b3ff14cf9e2b3a7c4401987c574
Closes-Bug:  #1801657
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idf52b7aeecc46b3ff14cf9e2b3a7c4401987c574
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

commit_message:
Add config option use_dumb_init to add it to container images

Usage of dumb-init can also be disabled from cli with
`--nouse-dumb-init` when building images.

Also moves ENTRYPOINT outside of dumb_init_installation
block.

Change-Id: Id32d54fc9913b83cf121ede5a5e265e0772062ae
Related-Bug: #1821970

The tasks for notification always run as the variables are mostly
defined with the same values as the normal message queue.

This patch skips creating the notification vhost/user if they
are matching the messaging one.

Change-Id: I03c2192b844f99648fe8b9c60e33b359f3997360
'}]
commit_message:
mq_setup: run notify setup *only* if users are different

The tasks for notification always run as the variables are mostly
defined with the same values as the normal message queue.

This patch skips creating the notification vhost/user if they
are matching the messaging one.

Change-Id: I03c2192b844f99648fe8b9c60e33b359f3997360

subject: Set min version of python-cinderclient to 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-10 10:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Set min version of python-cinderclient to 4.0.0

As of Stein, a minimum of python-cinderclient 4.0.0 is required to
create a volume. Cinder schema no longer accepts additional
properties on volume create that are not part of the API spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573093/

Change-Id: I0fc4d5db39080985b471fe2465b7078e37417e4d
Closes-Bug: #1824017
'}]
commit_message:
Set min version of python-cinderclient to 4.0.0

As of Stein, a minimum of python-cinderclient 4.0.0 is required to
create a volume. Cinder schema no longer accepts additional
properties on volume create that are not part of the API spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573093/

Change-Id: I0fc4d5db39080985b471fe2465b7078e37417e4d
Closes-Bug: #1824017

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-28 15:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Check for build request even if instance mapping doesn't exist

It is possible that an inconsistent state of the database could
lead to a build request being created but an instance mapping
failing to be created.  In this case, you end up with an instance
that cannot be retrieved even though it has a build request.

This patch add tests to check if an instance exists with a build
request and without a mapping and fixes the code to make sure to
return that build request if the instance mapping is missing, in
order to allow for deleting these instances.

Change-Id: Ieee6a0c8b1b1a1644d008da33cbd5512d096d4b1
Closes-Bug: #1784093
"}]
commit_message:
Check for build request even if instance mapping doesn't exist

It is possible that an inconsistent state of the database could
lead to a build request being created but an instance mapping
failing to be created.  In this case, you end up with an instance
that cannot be retrieved even though it has a build request.

This patch add tests to check if an instance exists with a build
request and without a mapping and fixes the code to make sure to
return that build request if the instance mapping is missing, in
order to allow for deleting these instances.

Change-Id: Ieee6a0c8b1b1a1644d008da33cbd5512d096d4b1
Closes-Bug: #1784093

commit_message:
Add hostId to metadata service

The hostId is an extremely useful piece of information for instances
which can help in troubleshooting by finding out if instances are
running on the same compute node or for services that need to do
any scheduling by having awareness of which VMs are colocated on
the same compute node.

This patch adds the `hostId` inside the Rocky version of the
metadata alongside the tests it needs.

Change-Id: Ib366d95e119f4b0f37aa2bed46e5899e735d590f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-07 23:20:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user/filter-scheduler.rst', 'nova/scheduler/weights/ram_percentage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/weights/test_weights_ram_percentage.py'], 'message': 'Introduce new percentage based RAM weigher

The existing RAM weigher depends only on the total amount of
free memory in a hypervisor.  This can be an issue in
environments where the amount of total memory in hypervisors
is different, where the scheduler will stack on the hyperviors
with a lot of memory, creating hotspots of usage across
the cluster.

This patch introduces a new percentage based RAM weigher which
will help in these cases, allowing to instead weigh on the
percentage of free memory.

Change-Id: I741426e22b3fda5024a111c011e64524f7dd243e
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce new percentage based RAM weigher

The existing RAM weigher depends only on the total amount of
free memory in a hypervisor.  This can be an issue in
environments where the amount of total memory in hypervisors
is different, where the scheduler will stack on the hyperviors
with a lot of memory, creating hotspots of usage across
the cluster.

This patch introduces a new percentage based RAM weigher which
will help in these cases, allowing to instead weigh on the
percentage of free memory.

Change-Id: I741426e22b3fda5024a111c011e64524f7dd243e

commit_message:
failover: add negative test for failover without amps

It is possible that the amphora gets deleted during failover
but not properly re-created which leaves the load balancer in
a state where it cannot be failed over due to the fact that
it has no amphorae assigned to it.

Change-Id: I1a2d4dda7c68df616beed4c5fb7f5b40ef6ae78f
Story: #2004440
Task: #28104

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-20 19:21:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/status.py'], 'message': 'Add machine output for nova-status upgrade checks

It is quite hard to predict what will need to be done during an
upgrade by an automated system and aimlessly just running upgrade
related tasks in a deployment might introduce all sorts of issues.

The following patch adds a `--machine` argument to the nova-status
upgrade check command which prints out only warning/error messages,
one every line.

Orchestration and installation tools can run this once and ignore
the exit status, go through the steps required to handle each one
such as restart placement if it notices `PLACEMENT_OUT_OF_DATE` in
the output and then runs it again, checking the exit code the
second time around as it should have taken care of all the needed
steps.

Change-Id: Iaa83b014f6b44dc291604f5d7ffa1608cef1becf
'}]
commit_message:
Add machine output for nova-status upgrade checks

It is quite hard to predict what will need to be done during an
upgrade by an automated system and aimlessly just running upgrade
related tasks in a deployment might introduce all sorts of issues.

The following patch adds a `--machine` argument to the nova-status
upgrade check command which prints out only warning/error messages,
one every line.

Orchestration and installation tools can run this once and ignore
the exit status, go through the steps required to handle each one
such as restart placement if it notices `PLACEMENT_OUT_OF_DATE` in
the output and then runs it again, checking the exit code the
second time around as it should have taken care of all the needed
steps.

Change-Id: Iaa83b014f6b44dc291604f5d7ffa1608cef1becf

subject: redhat: stop updating system unnecessarily
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-27 15:30:21.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'message': "redhat: stop updating system unnecessarily

In RHEL-based operating systems, the update will actually attempt
to update every single package in the system which can result in
bad things (i.e. updating services when they're not supposed to).

The intention was to do the same as the apt-get update which simply
updates the repos. however this is not necessary in CentOS.

Change-Id: I5a1f86899406e125b3a790e2e85ce36d73fbc55e
(cherry picked from commit b15b97fa0ab73579e4939ae767a2810196b33df2)
"}]
commit_message:
redhat: stop updating system unnecessarily

In RHEL-based operating systems, the update will actually attempt
to update every single package in the system which can result in
bad things (i.e. updating services when they're not supposed to).

The intention was to do the same as the apt-get update which simply
updates the repos. however this is not necessary in CentOS.

Change-Id: I5a1f86899406e125b3a790e2e85ce36d73fbc55e
(cherry picked from commit b15b97fa0ab73579e4939ae767a2810196b33df2)

subject: Check for keys ending with git_install_branch
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-09 17:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-repo-url-override-cc223de4ff82705e.yaml', 'lookup/py_pkgs.py'], 'message': 'Check for keys ending with git_install_branch

In order for py_pkgs to parse a file for Git packages, it looks
for any keys ending with git_repo.  However, if you are trying to
pin to an upstream commit, you may be confused that things are
not working.

This changes the behaviour so that if you specify an install
branch, it will treat the file as one which contains Git packages
rather than relying on the fact that a repo is configured.

Change-Id: I08bf1bdb103871a8cd282fc78982b54ee2b900a6
'}]
commit_message:
Check for keys ending with git_install_branch

In order for py_pkgs to parse a file for Git packages, it looks
for any keys ending with git_repo.  However, if you are trying to
pin to an upstream commit, you may be confused that things are
not working.

This changes the behaviour so that if you specify an install
branch, it will treat the file as one which contains Git packages
rather than relying on the fact that a repo is configured.

Change-Id: I08bf1bdb103871a8cd282fc78982b54ee2b900a6

commit_message:
nspawn: setup basic networking structure

It is problematic to be using macvlan interfaces to provide networking
therefore, we're going to switch back to using a normal veth pair and
bridge for the flat/public network only.

Change-Id: I9d7c89fc2d3a0a29cac083eaf7fbc5f8e94f8b0a

commit_message:
Switch to downloading images from LXC mirrors

This patch allows downloading directly from the LXC mirrors by
default which seem to be fairly reasonable source of truth.

They are also mirrored in the OpenStack infrastructure so they
should be faster to pull down and more reliable.  The option
to specify a URL is still available.

Depends-On: I092d6b404353669d29867e19d95196daffaab84a
Change-Id: Ia9feeb66f82071031106659219e2a90f70678e9a

commit_message:
Enable passing nspawn jobs

This patch contains a few changes which are squashed in order
to make it much easier to backport to Rocky.

- Added management network configuration for `mv-container`
- Renamed tasks to create mounts to correct ones
- Converted AIO and AIO nspawn configurations to match network
  values.
- Added dummy interfaces and br-vlan for all deployments

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/619343
Change-Id: Ib3d66d072b074ef5bb7851dcab7d5455f2b5693f

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: Idec9e2647090ee7329330d4b5727b037c60891c7

subject: Use ironic inspector 'dnsmasq' PXE filter by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-10 09:24:46.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ironic/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/deploy.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/ironic-inspector-dnsmasq-pxe-filter-ab012028bcd7d332.yaml'], 'message': "Use ironic inspector 'dnsmasq' PXE filter by default

With Docker CE, the daemon sets the default policy of the iptables
FORWARD chain to DROP. This causes problems for provisioning bare metal
servers when ironic inspector is used with the 'iptables' PXE filter.
It's not entirely clear why these two things interact in this way,
but switching to the 'dnsmasq' filter works around the issue, and is
probably a good move anyway because it is more efficient.

We have added a migration task here to flush and remove the ironic-inspector
iptables chain since inspector does not do this itself currently.

Change-Id: Iceed5a096819203eb2b92466d39575d3adf8e218
Closes-Bug: #1823044
(cherry picked from commit 86e83faeb1fd088d44c5108a5ec835eba6316b2d)
"}]
commit_message:
Use ironic inspector 'dnsmasq' PXE filter by default

With Docker CE, the daemon sets the default policy of the iptables
FORWARD chain to DROP. This causes problems for provisioning bare metal
servers when ironic inspector is used with the 'iptables' PXE filter.
It's not entirely clear why these two things interact in this way,
but switching to the 'dnsmasq' filter works around the issue, and is
probably a good move anyway because it is more efficient.

We have added a migration task here to flush and remove the ironic-inspector
iptables chain since inspector does not do this itself currently.

Change-Id: Iceed5a096819203eb2b92466d39575d3adf8e218
Closes-Bug: #1823044
(cherry picked from commit 86e83faeb1fd088d44c5108a5ec835eba6316b2d)

subject: Allow more generic overrides for ceilometer-api
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-04-10 10:24:07.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/templates/bin/_ceilometer-api.sh.tpl', 'ceilometer/values.yaml', 'ceilometer/templates/configmap-etc.yaml', 'ceilometer/templates/deployment-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow more generic overrides for ceilometer-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some
of the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting
the default values if those values are not overriden.

The following values are introduced to be overriden:
conf:
  security:
  software:
    apache2:
      conf_dir:
      site_dir:
      mods_dir:
      binary:
      start_flags:
      a2enmod:
      a2dismod:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files
 * site_dir: directory where to drop the enabled virtualhosts
 * mods_dir: directory where to drop any mod configuration
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * start_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: mods to disable
 * security: security configuration for apache

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set to what
they used to be as to not disrupt existing deployments.

Change-Id: Ibb7e3bec0f6561bccc6a1aea907a2f3e4e1bfb73
'}]
commit_message:
Allow more generic overrides for ceilometer-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some
of the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting
the default values if those values are not overriden.

The following values are introduced to be overriden:
conf:
  security:
  software:
    apache2:
      conf_dir:
      site_dir:
      mods_dir:
      binary:
      start_flags:
      a2enmod:
      a2dismod:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files
 * site_dir: directory where to drop the enabled virtualhosts
 * mods_dir: directory where to drop any mod configuration
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * start_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: mods to disable
 * security: security configuration for apache

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set to what
they used to be as to not disrupt existing deployments.

Change-Id: Ibb7e3bec0f6561bccc6a1aea907a2f3e4e1bfb73

commit_message:
Update minimum hardware version

hardware had a bug in ppc64le (and a slightly different bug on aarch64)
this creates a regression and means that introspection on those
architectures fail.

Update the minimum required version to 0.20.1 to get the bugfix

Change-Id: I583dd9f164eae33f7c8cac4505df76e57415aa93
See: https://github.com/redhat-cip/hardware/issues/80

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-12 22:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/python_venv_install.yml'], 'message': 'Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6
(cherry picked from commit b2abfe4bad7e7b440e79b048461cfbfda2b06757)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6
(cherry picked from commit b2abfe4bad7e7b440e79b048461cfbfda2b06757)

subject: Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-08 15:35:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/monitors/test_monitors.py', 'nova/compute/monitors/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors

The compute_monitors configuration option is empty by
default, however, on nova-compute startup we get a warning
logged saying:

  Excluding nova.compute.monitors.cpu monitor virt_driver. \
  Not in the list of enabled monitors (CONF.compute_monitors).

This is unnecessary noise in the logs when nova-compute is
not configured to use monitors, so this change avoids the warning
log message in that case.

The compute_monitors configuration option help text is also
updated to (1) fix formatting and (2) remove the mention of the
numa_mem_bw monitor which never made it into nova (see
blueprint memory-bw).

Change-Id: I5bd204e0017f6f795e3cf13b34b75124ee23aa78
Closes-Bug: #1823207
(cherry picked from commit 8795f591d541227cd704019f19f3a78c74fc8ac7)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors

The compute_monitors configuration option is empty by
default, however, on nova-compute startup we get a warning
logged saying:

  Excluding nova.compute.monitors.cpu monitor virt_driver. \
  Not in the list of enabled monitors (CONF.compute_monitors).

This is unnecessary noise in the logs when nova-compute is
not configured to use monitors, so this change avoids the warning
log message in that case.

The compute_monitors configuration option help text is also
updated to (1) fix formatting and (2) remove the mention of the
numa_mem_bw monitor which never made it into nova (see
blueprint memory-bw).

Change-Id: I5bd204e0017f6f795e3cf13b34b75124ee23aa78
Closes-Bug: #1823207
(cherry picked from commit 8795f591d541227cd704019f19f3a78c74fc8ac7)

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for heat

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the heat-api, heat-cfn, and heat-cloudwatch
services. This provides the ability to audit API requests
for heat.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: Ib5a7dfd882416553ff6f43aa009e3e67871d7f4c

commit_message:
Check if source directory does exist before linking

If Ansible runs in dry-run mode (ie with the "--check" arg) it will not
create the /var/log/swift directory, and thus a subsequent task to
create a link to it will fail.

Closes-Bug: 1800457
Change-Id: Ia84f979b5f8d07dfc8b6cd162e1491bbea95c5d7
(cherry picked from commit 618229e7dcc31ad945d9c9f1bc70a9bffe6cec0d)

commit_message:
new-release: Handle em for untagged repos

This updates the new-release command to use the last release for normal
repos when transitioning to -em, but grabbing the current HEAD when
tagging "release-model: untagged" deliverables.

Change-Id: I42acb74d033429a72946fda136f87b4ccaefb220
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Tag ocata-em for openstack-ansible repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-12 08:24:45.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/ocata/openstack-ansible.yaml'], 'message': 'Tag ocata-em for openstack-ansible repos

This case is a little special, so here is the justifications:
openstack-ansible-security has been deprecated and replaced
by ansible-hardening. Ocata branch is already non-taggable anymore.
To pass validation and prevent the branch from being recreated,
references to that repo have been removed.

Next to this, OpenStack-Ansible roles haven't been tagged since we
decided to stop tagging them. Using the last tags for EM look
inappropriate, as it doesn't carry the meaning of EM at the first
place ("From this on, you are on your own"). This would be just
fine by reusing OpenStack-Ansible latest role shas (current
HEAD of their ocata branch).

The OpenStack-Ansible main repo last tag could have been
used for the EM. However, this last tag is broken, due to an
external factor (some external git repo changed its versionning).
Instead of using a broken tag for EM, I am here asking for
using HEAD instead, exceptionally.

Change-Id: I0d471c38841611bf08c3f31aad698bf0f7e3e412
'}]
commit_message:
Tag ocata-em for openstack-ansible repos

This case is a little special, so here is the justifications:
openstack-ansible-security has been deprecated and replaced
by ansible-hardening. Ocata branch is already non-taggable anymore.
To pass validation and prevent the branch from being recreated,
references to that repo have been removed.

Next to this, OpenStack-Ansible roles haven't been tagged since we
decided to stop tagging them. Using the last tags for EM look
inappropriate, as it doesn't carry the meaning of EM at the first
place ("From this on, you are on your own"). This would be just
fine by reusing OpenStack-Ansible latest role shas (current
HEAD of their ocata branch).

The OpenStack-Ansible main repo last tag could have been
used for the EM. However, this last tag is broken, due to an
external factor (some external git repo changed its versionning).
Instead of using a broken tag for EM, I am here asking for
using HEAD instead, exceptionally.

Change-Id: I0d471c38841611bf08c3f31aad698bf0f7e3e412

subject: Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-02 15:10:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1669054.py'], 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The (test_)request_spec.py conflicts are due to not
having change I2131558f0edfe603ee1e8d8bae66a3caf5182a58 in Queens.
test_save_does_not_persist_requested_fields from that change is
ported and modified here to just deal with the ignore_hosts field.
The test_conductor.py conflict is due to not having change
I640562b8dd049ff5b6fea9286dc3082b9d837ed3 in Queens.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The (test_)request_spec.py conflicts are due to not
having change I2131558f0edfe603ee1e8d8bae66a3caf5182a58 in Queens.
test_save_does_not_persist_requested_fields from that change is
ported and modified here to just deal with the ignore_hosts field.
The test_conductor.py conflict is due to not having change
I640562b8dd049ff5b6fea9286dc3082b9d837ed3 in Queens.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-02 15:10:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1669054.py'], 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport differs slightly in that the test setup
calls set_stub_network_methods because change
I1dbccc2be6ba79bf267edac9208c80e187e6256a is not in Queens.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit 556cf103b22ab6bebecc9d824d6f918cda38fe3e)
(cherry picked from commit 20c1414945db633ed00c1f19f1f0d163028454d9)
(cherry picked from commit 77164128bf5eef53b49547658be2ef902c020207)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport differs slightly in that the test setup
calls set_stub_network_methods because change
I1dbccc2be6ba79bf267edac9208c80e187e6256a is not in Queens.

Change-Id: I6ce2d6b1baf47796f867aede1acf292ec9739d6d
Related-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit 556cf103b22ab6bebecc9d824d6f918cda38fe3e)
(cherry picked from commit 20c1414945db633ed00c1f19f1f0d163028454d9)
(cherry picked from commit 77164128bf5eef53b49547658be2ef902c020207)

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute

commit_message:
Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute
node resource provider since the instance is not actually
consuming the source node provider resources.

This change refactors the error handling around the _confirm_resize
call so the big nesting for _error_out_instance_on_exception is
moved to confirm_resize and then a try/finally is added around
_confirm_resize so we can be sure to try and cleanup the allocations
even if _confirm_resize fails in some obscure way. If _confirm_resize
does fail, the error gets re-raised along with logging a traceback
and hint about how to correct the instance state in the DB by hard
rebooting the server on the dest host.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I49034f87e240775cca7a4d769819dd788b86832a in Stein.

Change-Id: I29c5f491ec20a71283190a1599e7732541de736f
Closes-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 03a6d26691c1f182224d59190b79f48df278099e)

subject: Error out migration when confirm_resize fails
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-03 13:33:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'Error out migration when confirm_resize fails

If anything fails and raises an exception during
confirm_resize, the migration status is stuck in
"confirming" status even though the instance status
may be "ERROR".

This change adds the errors_out_migration decorator
to the confirm_resize method to make sure the migration
status is "error" if an error is raised.

In bug 1821594 it was the driver.confirm_migration
method that raised some exception, so a unit test is
added here which simulates a similar scenario.

This only partially closes the bug because we are still
leaking allocations on the source node resource provider
since _delete_allocation_after_move is not called. That
will be dealt with in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ic7d78ad43a2bad7f932c22c98944accbbed9e9e2
Partial-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 408ef8f84a698f764aa5d769d6d01fd9340de2e5)
'}]
commit_message:
Error out migration when confirm_resize fails

If anything fails and raises an exception during
confirm_resize, the migration status is stuck in
"confirming" status even though the instance status
may be "ERROR".

This change adds the errors_out_migration decorator
to the confirm_resize method to make sure the migration
status is "error" if an error is raised.

In bug 1821594 it was the driver.confirm_migration
method that raised some exception, so a unit test is
added here which simulates a similar scenario.

This only partially closes the bug because we are still
leaking allocations on the source node resource provider
since _delete_allocation_after_move is not called. That
will be dealt with in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ic7d78ad43a2bad7f932c22c98944accbbed9e9e2
Partial-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 408ef8f84a698f764aa5d769d6d01fd9340de2e5)

subject: Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-10 16:21:21.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/python_venv_install.yml'], 'message': 'Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6
'}]
commit_message:
Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-06 12:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'stack.sh: Clear OpenStack related envvars

stack.sh usually fails when it is started in a shell session
where OpenStack related environment variables OS_* are set.
Most common failure scenarios are failures in keystone operations.

This commits clears OpenStack related environment variables
at the begining of stack.sh.

Change-Id: I3a924a0586dc9bb28f3bf3e151e100c24015efe5
'}]
commit_message:
stack.sh: Clear OpenStack related envvars

stack.sh usually fails when it is started in a shell session
where OpenStack related environment variables OS_* are set.
Most common failure scenarios are failures in keystone operations.

This commits clears OpenStack related environment variables
at the begining of stack.sh.

Change-Id: I3a924a0586dc9bb28f3bf3e151e100c24015efe5

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-02 23:00:27.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conf/conductor.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/send-sensor-data-for-all-nodes-a732d9df43e74318.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Make it possible to send sensor data for all nodes

Presently the data collection defaults to only permit
sensor data to be collected and transmitted as notifications
for instances deployed via nova, however standalone operators
or general data center operators may find the sensor data
useful to identify undeployed failing hardware and overall
check the hardware health.

Adds a boolean to control the filter being set for a deployed
node.

Change-Id: I345f6e3a9f47d8d09ea488d64927fd0c5fb7dfc7
'}]
commit_message:
Make it possible to send sensor data for all nodes

Presently the data collection defaults to only permit
sensor data to be collected and transmitted as notifications
for instances deployed via nova, however standalone operators
or general data center operators may find the sensor data
useful to identify undeployed failing hardware and overall
check the hardware health.

Adds a boolean to control the filter being set for a deployed
node.

Change-Id: I345f6e3a9f47d8d09ea488d64927fd0c5fb7dfc7

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-01 17:17:24.000000000', 'files': ['specs/keystone/backlog/complete-rbac.rst'], 'message': 'Complete RBAC in keystone

This spec proposes to perform all needed access control checks in keystone
rather than separate the process into:
- policy enforcement performed by every service using oslo.policy
- delegation(assignment) management done by keystone

Implements bp complete-rbac

Change-Id: Iaee3c2a02c91a40cd725da807cc3fef5192f2b94
'}]
commit_message:
Complete RBAC in keystone

This spec proposes to perform all needed access control checks in keystone
rather than separate the process into:
- policy enforcement performed by every service using oslo.policy
- delegation(assignment) management done by keystone

Implements bp complete-rbac

Change-Id: Iaee3c2a02c91a40cd725da807cc3fef5192f2b94

commit_message:
Stop iscsid when running FFU tasks.

iscsid service should not be running on the host after upgrading to queens.
The THT tasks for doing this are missing.

stable/queens only fix

Change-Id: Ie459c8c03e03dab0df657e3f6514435457ede155
Closes-bug: 1821600

and enables it for the ceilometer-api service. This provides

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for ceilometer

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the ceilometer-api service. This provides
the ability to audit API requests for ceilometer.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: I9d49769bc04f9623ecf5ba4276665dc3b5bebd07

subject: Remove unnecessary GPG keys setting for YUM repos.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-06 21:57:25.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceph_preinstall_yum.yml'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary GPG keys setting for YUM repos.

We add the GPG keys in the previous task so there is no need to
do this inside the YUM task, also, it breaks things because Ansible
expects this to be a string and it's getting a list.

Change-Id: I82f1095bd0e21d76d0246b0c22792878edfb44bf
(cherry picked from commit d0922e347d055fcf0abc2ef0f91605ad4f8d5c3e)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary GPG keys setting for YUM repos.

We add the GPG keys in the previous task so there is no need to
do this inside the YUM task, also, it breaks things because Ansible
expects this to be a string and it's getting a list.

Change-Id: I82f1095bd0e21d76d0246b0c22792878edfb44bf
(cherry picked from commit d0922e347d055fcf0abc2ef0f91605ad4f8d5c3e)

commit_message:
flatten the ovn service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the ovn services.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening
Change-Id: I6261863c15f594fed8207ff258f1d9c809a9a864

subject: Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-02 13:37:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1669054.py'], 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8 in Rocky which added
the requested_resources field to the RequestSpec object.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8 in Rocky which added
the requested_resources field to the RequestSpec object.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping

commit_message:
Fix incomplete instance data returned after build failure

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping
exposes the cell's version of the instance to the API. If the API happened
to fetch it before it was finished being created it would return
incomplete data.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1820337
Change-Id: If966eb1161c842ff49aa530e4482dbca87b61a3e
(cherry picked from commit 64f6cbc9120e3c288f312eddc59452dee4998f93)

commit_message:
DVR: Correctly change MTU in fip namespace

The code that ensures the fpr/rfp veth pair exists
between the qrouter and fip namespace was only setting
the mtu of the devices if it had to create them.  Set
it all the time to support the mtu being changed.

Change-Id: I176b5f4d4f12cf09f930e2c1944e98082a09bcc6
Closes-bug: #1823798

subject: Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-20 18:38:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/audit/test_audit_oslo_messaging.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1695038-2cbedcabf8ecc057.yaml', 'keystonemiddleware/audit/_notifier.py', 'keystonemiddleware/audit/__init__.py'], 'message': "Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier

Add a configuration option, 'use_oslo_messaging', to indicate whether
to use oslo_messaging notifier. It is set to true for backwards
compatibility.
We can't use audit middleware with services like Swift, which have no
dependency on Oslo and does not work well with oslo_log. Swift uses rsyslog.
Currently, audit middleware indiscriminately chooses oslo_messaging if the
package is installed. This is problematic if Swift proxy is on the same
controller as any service which consumes oslo_messaging. With this new option,
Swift can now safely consume audit middleware by electing to use local
log notifier instead of oslo_messaging.

Change-Id: I87bf857c20e4b78e97d40dcc51a1b4ff0014abb2
Closes-Bug: #1695038
(cherry picked from commit e83bd0bc3c7973e45b677c1c7007770e3f4873b4)
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier

Add a configuration option, 'use_oslo_messaging', to indicate whether
to use oslo_messaging notifier. It is set to true for backwards
compatibility.
We can't use audit middleware with services like Swift, which have no
dependency on Oslo and does not work well with oslo_log. Swift uses rsyslog.
Currently, audit middleware indiscriminately chooses oslo_messaging if the
package is installed. This is problematic if Swift proxy is on the same
controller as any service which consumes oslo_messaging. With this new option,
Swift can now safely consume audit middleware by electing to use local
log notifier instead of oslo_messaging.

Change-Id: I87bf857c20e4b78e97d40dcc51a1b4ff0014abb2
Closes-Bug: #1695038
(cherry picked from commit e83bd0bc3c7973e45b677c1c7007770e3f4873b4)

commit_message:
Pin proliantutils version

This avoids an issue where the version installed could be incompatible
with ironic, or other installed libraries.

In particular, this was seen with proliantutils 2.8.2, which is
incompatible with the version of sushy-lib on the stable/rocky branch.

Change-Id: I02f1e247ca2333b2e90586e7311395e7bd94938c
Story: 2005310
Task: 30214
(cherry picked from commit 348b45aca8dc850840b3a3b656a6a8fc8f99bf47)

commit_message:
Pin proliantutils version

Change from master: pinned to <2.8.0 rather than 2.9.0.

This avoids an issue where the version installed could be incompatible
with ironic, or other installed libraries.

In particular, this was seen with proliantutils 2.8.2, which is
incompatible with the version of sushy-lib on the stable/rocky branch.

Change-Id: I02f1e247ca2333b2e90586e7311395e7bd94938c
Story: 2005310
Task: 30214
(cherry picked from commit 348b45aca8dc850840b3a3b656a6a8fc8f99bf47)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-10 02:35:10.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ibmc/test_power.py'], 'message': "Split ibmc power/reboot classes

We've seen some fun things in the past with
the test runner and things like sleep getting
mocked in the background resulting in some odd
behaviors when multiple tests are iterating
and performing calls.

Since that is the case, and we've seen the ibmc
reboot test case sporatically fail, lets try
splitting the reboot testing into its own test
class which results in a different runner thread
and some minor restructuring to limit variables.

Change-Id: I2051995cc7080ba42aedb57816ab8f63154c7f51
"}]
commit_message:
Split ibmc power/reboot classes

We've seen some fun things in the past with
the test runner and things like sleep getting
mocked in the background resulting in some odd
behaviors when multiple tests are iterating
and performing calls.

Since that is the case, and we've seen the ibmc
reboot test case sporatically fail, lets try
splitting the reboot testing into its own test
class which results in a different runner thread
and some minor restructuring to limit variables.

Change-Id: I2051995cc7080ba42aedb57816ab8f63154c7f51

commit_message:
Revert "Disable fullstack job from gate and make it non-voting"

This reverts commit d33e5f5c17e66a95216fefcda1d161f9a4c1f779.

After bugs [1] and [2] are fixed, fullstack job got back to acceptable failure rates and we can make it again voting and gating.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1820865
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1820870

Change-Id: I6feaaf563df93096f063e487a3ed086b93adcb0e

commit_message:
Improve trove guest agent image building

- Add a new element 'guest-agent' for image building. This element is
  used when dev_mode=false, so that the trove code is downloaded into
  the image during the building phase rather than during the guest
  agent initialization.
- Improve trovestack sub-command 'build-image'.

  ./trovestack build-image ${datastore_type} \
     ${guest_os} \
     ${guest_release} \
     ${dev_mode}

- Improve documentation.

Story: #2005387
Task: #30375

Change-Id: I9d7acbd6a97f8c01b48b0f2cf94398d549d89124
(cherry picked from commit 798af4d02a089ac2dd29b4d66fcd47186fb7342b)

commit_message:
Add checking mechanism driver during upgrade

Add checking of mechanism driver during prep upgrade.
Prevent upgrading a stack to a version of tripleo templates or
environment that specifies neutron mechanism drivers that are
incompatible with the existing stack.

Change-Id: Ia6085ca63de0d8c48ab9c5b5811f6ac3e5141c85
Closes-Bug: #1823042
(cherry picked from commit 0041ec4c54088f32994a2cdc7846ff0a6c46638c)

commit_message:
Move warn clause as a shell task option.

The warn clause should be included inside an args
subsection, otherwise the task will fail syntactically
with 'warn' is not a valid attribute for a Task.

Closes-Bug: #1824496
Change-Id: I217437c4d104475c8ea415dd178940c40264e0b0

subject: Make overcloud_config working with Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-11 15:01:18.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Make overcloud_config working with Python 3

Open and write the content from the file in Swift as bytes and in read mode,
otherwise Python 3 fails to open it as it comes as a string by default.

Change-Id: Ie6abc2e58cc7f349881f1315e3a56af9a6814791
Closes-Bug: #1824225
(cherry picked from commit ef0e50851536fee32f34ce8f4a8d88f4c39b7ada)
'}]
commit_message:
Make overcloud_config working with Python 3

Open and write the content from the file in Swift as bytes and in read mode,
otherwise Python 3 fails to open it as it comes as a string by default.

Change-Id: Ie6abc2e58cc7f349881f1315e3a56af9a6814791
Closes-Bug: #1824225
(cherry picked from commit ef0e50851536fee32f34ce8f4a8d88f4c39b7ada)

subject: Microversion 1.21 support
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-06 18:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['osc_placement/tests/functional/base.py', 'osc_placement/version.py', 'osc_placement/tests/functional/test_allocation_candidate.py', 'releasenotes/notes/microversion-1.21-allocation-candidates-aggregate-3460414fa6819b7f.yaml', 'osc_placement/resources/allocation_candidate.py'], 'message': "Microversion 1.21 support

Add support for member_of/aggregate-uuid when listing allocation
candidates. The choice of arguments intentionally mirrors those
used when listing resource providers, which means that the term
'member of' is not used.

Note that microversion 1.24 [1] is going to make argument parsing
in this area considerably more complex. Not for the computer, but
the humans using the tool. For now we probably want to do what's
here, to do the aforementioned mirroring, but when we get to 1.24
we'll need some brains.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/placement-api-microversion-history.html#support-multiple-member-of-queryparams

Change-Id: Iba3e31fec29e8e85aa2f6a4248f0a27d7373ba6d
"}]
commit_message:
Microversion 1.21 support

Add support for member_of/aggregate-uuid when listing allocation
candidates. The choice of arguments intentionally mirrors those
used when listing resource providers, which means that the term
'member of' is not used.

Note that microversion 1.24 [1] is going to make argument parsing
in this area considerably more complex. Not for the computer, but
the humans using the tool. For now we probably want to do what's
here, to do the aforementioned mirroring, but when we get to 1.24
we'll need some brains.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/placement-api-microversion-history.html#support-multiple-member-of-queryparams

Change-Id: Iba3e31fec29e8e85aa2f6a4248f0a27d7373ba6d

commit_message:
Fix usage of satellite in organization mode

When satellite is used in organization mode, deployments were failing
due to a change on code return on subscription manager. This last will
generate an error any way so this is a bypass.

Tested on queen.

Closes-Bug: #1822725

Change-Id: I0dd65cc752a6bd94bec59f695e55aa85ef8f0192
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d80a956d7266b12c593060fa0a01ed997771a8ee)

commit_message:
Fix usage of satellite in organization mode

When satellite is used in organization mode, deployments were failing
due to a change on code return on subscription manager. This last will
generate an error any way so this is a bypass.

Tested on queen.

Closes-Bug: #1822725

Change-Id: I0dd65cc752a6bd94bec59f695e55aa85ef8f0192
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d80a956d7266b12c593060fa0a01ed997771a8ee)

commit_message:
Enable bionic/stein and disco/stein functional tests

Drop explicit install of python-ceph; ceph-common has an
appropriate dependency on the required python{3}-ceph package
so this is not required, and breaks on Stein where Python 2
packages are no longer provided.

Closes-Bug: 1824154

commit_message:
deploy-steps-tasks: create /var/run/podman

Create /var/run/podman directory so we can configure Paunch to start
containers with PID files in this directory and not in /var/run.

It'll make PID files more easily discoverable for the operators.
A patch in paunch will be done to change the path of PID files but first
we need this one to create the directory, as libpod doesn't handle it.

Change-Id: Ib788fe78515860563be0c38eef510c01663d65d9

subject: Add support for 1.19 microversion
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-06 18:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['osc_placement/tests/functional/base.py', 'osc_placement/resources/aggregate.py', 'osc_placement/tests/functional/test_aggregate.py', 'osc_placement/version.py', 'releasenotes/notes/microversion-1.19-resource-provider-aggregate-generation-c276739ec1cbc549.yaml'], 'message': 'Add support for 1.19 microversion

The 1.19 microversion of placement adds support for the
generation parameter when setting aggregates on a resource
provider. The value is an integer generation, available
when listing or showing resource providers.

If an earlier version is chosen, but a --generation arg
provided, an error is reported. Similarly, if not generation
is provided and the version is 1.19 or later, an error
is reported.

The new TestAggregate119 inherits from TestAggregate to
repeat the general validation it does, overrides those
methods which require a generation when using version
1.19, and adds two failure tests. One test in the super
class is adjusted so that it works as desired in both
classes and in both versions of Python (Python3 has
different behavor of a *args before kw args). I considered
changing the signature of base.resource_provider_aggregate_set
but that would have meant changes is several places.

Change-Id: I74157998dd19d8a8d2b68d12ed3726aac11eb013
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for 1.19 microversion

The 1.19 microversion of placement adds support for the
generation parameter when setting aggregates on a resource
provider. The value is an integer generation, available
when listing or showing resource providers.

If an earlier version is chosen, but a --generation arg
provided, an error is reported. Similarly, if not generation
is provided and the version is 1.19 or later, an error
is reported.

The new TestAggregate119 inherits from TestAggregate to
repeat the general validation it does, overrides those
methods which require a generation when using version
1.19, and adds two failure tests. One test in the super
class is adjusted so that it works as desired in both
classes and in both versions of Python (Python3 has
different behavor of a *args before kw args). I considered
changing the signature of base.resource_provider_aggregate_set
but that would have meant changes is several places.

Change-Id: I74157998dd19d8a8d2b68d12ed3726aac11eb013

subject: Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-09 07:15:42.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_api/tests/test_repositories.py', 'monasca_api/common/repositories/cassandra/metrics_repository.py'], 'message': "Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

"}]
commit_message:
Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

It is possible for a row in Cassandra to have a missing metric_hash
(shows as 'null' in cqlsh). This causes an ugly NoneType error
to be passed up to the user on the command line for
'monaca metric-list'.

Fix is to detect the missing value, log an error, and return the
row with None for the metric[id].

This commit is effectively the same as
commit Ie617932c6b12a6cfe441510e120bb77a3470b9cf but had
to be reworked to backport to stable/pike.

Change-Id: I51c935534062f7e18a5609830778052b6cc58adb
Story: 2005305
Task: 30194

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-10 14:10:55.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml', 'devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Use the PUBLIC_BRIDGE for vxlan

The PUBLIC_BRIDGE parameter, for most multinode zuul jobs
defaults to br-infra in cases where native zuul configuration
is used.

However, this is not true for legacy jobs still using devstack-gate.

When jobs are invoked with devstack-gate, the bridge must be set
to match the devstack-gate scripting as zuul *does not* setup the
vxlan bridge for us. Devstack-gate does so.

Change-Id: I37bff3c4d930ada483690d0dea17cb9a64d51fd2
'}]
commit_message:
Use the PUBLIC_BRIDGE for vxlan

The PUBLIC_BRIDGE parameter, for most multinode zuul jobs
defaults to br-infra in cases where native zuul configuration
is used.

However, this is not true for legacy jobs still using devstack-gate.

When jobs are invoked with devstack-gate, the bridge must be set
to match the devstack-gate scripting as zuul *does not* setup the
vxlan bridge for us. Devstack-gate does so.

Change-Id: I37bff3c4d930ada483690d0dea17cb9a64d51fd2

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-09-15 14:10:04.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I26e33ebd69ba569c913a588648e223f121be513f
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I26e33ebd69ba569c913a588648e223f121be513f

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iae2cb476630fad31faa588939327d32b91a4de07
